snippet: The country’s biggest brokerage firms unveiled a government-backed plan to buy shares, while its stock exchanges suspended all further initial public offerings of stock.
abstract: Twenty-one of China's largest brokerage firms unveil government-endorsed plan to buy shares of stock and stop selling shares in their own portfolios in effort to halt decline in country's stock markets; some experts say move may not be enough to stop precipitous declines.

byline.original: By KEITH BRADSHER and CHRIS BUCKLEY

lead_paragraph: The country’s biggest brokerage firms unveiled a government-backed plan to buy shares, while its stock exchanges suspended all further initial public offerings of stock.

headline.main: China Moves to Stabilize Stock Markets; Initial Offerings Halted
headline.print_headline: China Moves to Stabilize Plunging Stock Markets; Exchanges Halt I.P.O.s
